Evaluations (Before and After Reports)

The City of Seattle has transformed 36 different roads since 1972. We can confidently say that not only does redesigning our streets make them safer, but it keeps people and goods moving. The Federal Highway Administration agrees. A 2010 study looked at 30 redesigned street in Washington and California and determined there was a 19 percent reduction in collision rate. Read our before and after reports to learn more.

Report Date 35th Avenue SW Road Safety Corridor Report 2015 Fauntleroy Street Rechannelization 2010 NE 65th St Redesign: Before and After Study 2020 NE 75th St Road Safety Redesign 2015 NE 125th Street Rechannelization - Before and After Report 2014 Nickerson Paving and Rechannelization Plan 2010 Nickerson Rechannelization: Before and After Study 2012 Nickerson Rechannelization FAQ 2009 Rainier Ave S Safety Corridor Pilot Project 2017 Stone Way N Rechannelization: Before and After Study 2010

Planning Studies

Our Policy and Planning Division works with other departments and different communities to implement transportation elements of neighborhood plans and identify community transportation priorities. Current planning efforts can be found in our Planning Program page. Past plans include:
